text: Jaume Serra i Cau (, ; died 1517) was a Spanish Valencian cardinal, from the city of Valencia. He was tutor to the young Giovanni Borgia,Michael Mallett (1969), The Borgias, p. 118. and a close associate of his father Pope Alexander VI.Mallett, p. 164, 201. He was archbishop of Oristano in 1492, and was created Cardinal in 1500. He was bishop of Linköping in 1501, bishop of Elne in 1506. He was bishop of Albano in 1511, and possibly bishop of Palestrina in 1516 (sources disagree). He was Governor of Rome, and Governor of CesenaMallett, p. 191. He was buried in San Giacomo degli Spagnoli, where a mortuary chapel was built for him. ==Notes== ==External links== * Category:1517 deaths Category:Spanish Roman Catholics Category:Spanish cardinals Category:Cardinals created by Pope Alexander VI Category:Cardinal- bishops of Albano Category:Bishops of Elna Category:Year of birth unknown
title: Jaume Serra i Cau
